steps.description: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 10-15 minutes until soft, then drain.
In a hot pan, add oil and cook shrimp until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from pan and set aside.
Crack an egg into the pan and scramble until just cooked.
Add drained noodles, tamarind paste, and fish sauce to the pan. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until noodles are coated and hot.
Return shrimp to the pan and add bean sprouts, green onions, and crushed peanuts. Stir well and cook for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of chili flakes and lime wedges on the side.
Prepare marinade with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Marinate pork cubes for at least 1 hour.
Thread marinated pork onto skewers.
Grill skewers over medium heat for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally until pork is cooked through.
Warm pita bread on the grill for 1-2 minutes on each side.
Serve grilled pork in pita bread, add sliced onions, tomatoes, and a generous dollop of tzatziki sauce.
Dice the white fish into small cubes and place it in a non-metallic bowl.
Pour lime and orange juice over the fish, ensuring it is fully submerged. Marinate for 15-20 minutes until the fish is opaque.
Add finely chopped red onions and freshly chopped cilantro to the fish mixture.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Mix well.
Serve the ceviche chilled, accompanied by tortilla chips for dipping.
Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions until al dente.
Heat the pork broth in a pot until it begins to simmer.
Add the cooked noodles to the hot broth and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Gently place soft-boiled eggs, chopped green onions, and a sheet of nori on top. Serve hot.
Prepare the whole duck by cleaning and letting it air dry in a cool place for several hours.
Roast the duck in a preheated oven until the skin is crispy and golden brown, usually around 1.5 hours.
Once roasted, remove the duck from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Slice the duck into thin pieces and serve with Chinese pancakes and hoisin sauce.
In a large skillet, cook the ground beef and pork sausage over medium heat until browned.
Add chopped onions, garlic, and bell peppers to the skillet and sauté until soft.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and Italian spices. Simmer for 15 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and egg until well combined.
Layer the baking dish with lasagna sheets, meat sauce, and cheese mixture. Repeat layers.
Top with remaining mozzarella cheese and bake in preheated oven at 180°C for 30-40 minutes until golden.
Let the lasagna rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Layer cooked ham and Gruyère cheese between two slices of bread, buttered side out.
Toast in the oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
For added flavor, sprinkle with grated Gruyère cheese on top and broil for an additional 3-5 minutes.
Serve hot with a side salad or fries.
Boil the beetroot until tender, about 30-40 minutes.
Chop the cabbage, carrots, onions, and potatoes.
Sauté onions and carrots in a pot with oil until softened.
Add chopped cabbage and sauté for an additional 5 minutes.
Add boiled beetroot, chopped potatoes, and vegetable broth to the pot.
Simmer until all vegetables are cooked, about 20-30 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and optional spices like dill or bay leaves.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream on top.
Prepare the dough by mixing flour, water, and salt, then let it rest for 30 minutes.
Chop the onion, garlic, and bell pepper into small pieces.
In a skillet, cook the chopped onion and garlic until translucent.
Add ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned.
Add chopped bell pepper, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the skillet, and mix well.
Remove the skillet from heat and let the filling cool.
Roll out the dough and cut it into circles.
Place a spoonful of filling on each dough circle, fold, and seal the edges.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Place the sealed empanadas on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
Rinse the long grain rice thoroughly under cold water and set aside to drain.
In a blender, combine tomato puree and diced tomatoes to create a smooth sauce.
In a pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the blended tomato sauce and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add Jollof spices mix, bay leaves, thyme, salt, and black pepper to the pot, stirring well to combine.
Add the rinsed rice to the pot, stirring to coat the rice with the sauce.
Pour in enough water to cover the rice by about an inch, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-30 minutes until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the liquid.
Remove from heat and let it sit for 5-10 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Serve warm, optionally garnished with additional herbs or vegetables.
In a large pot, bring 500 ml of chicken broth to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add 2 tablespoons of fish sauce to the boiling broth to enhance the flavor.
Add 50 g of lemongrass, cut into 2-inch pieces, and bruise it slightly with a knife to release its aroma.
Add 30 g of galangal, sliced, to the pot along with 4-5 kaffir lime leaves, torn into pieces.
Reduce heat to medium and let the broth simmer for 10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add 200 g of shrimp (peeled and deveined) and 1-2 Thai chilies (sliced) to the pot.
Cook until the shrimp are pink and opaque, about 3-5 minutes. Do not overcook.
Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning, adding more fish sauce if needed.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.
Pound the veal cutlets to flatten to about 1/4 inch thick.
Set up a breading station with flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs.
Dip each cutlet first in flour, then in egg, and finally coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with lemon wedges and a side of potato salad.
Fry the frozen French fries until golden and crispy.
Heat the beef gravy until hot, stirring occasionally.
Layer fries on a plate, pour hot gravy over them, and sprinkle with fresh cheese curds.
Serve immediately and enjoy with a side of pickles.
Slice the eggplant and sprinkle with salt. Let it sit to remove bitterness.
Cook the ground lamb with spices until browned.
Layer eggplant, meat mixture, and pour bechamel sauce on top.
Bake until golden brown and set.
Brew a strong espresso and let it cool.
Mix mascarpone with sugar and eggs until smooth.
Dip ladyfingers in coffee and layer with mascarpone mixture.
Chill in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy and golden brown. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese until smooth. Season with black pepper to taste.
Once spaghetti is cooked, reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain the rest. Quickly add the spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta. Stir to combine.
Remove skillet from heat. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the spaghetti, tossing quickly to combine. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time until desired creaminess is achieved.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan cheese and a sprinkle of black pepper.
Marinate chicken in spices, yogurt, and lemon juice for at least an hour.
Cook marinated chicken in a skillet until browned.
Prepare the sauce by simmering tomato puree, cream, garlic, ginger, and cilantro together.
Combine chicken and sauce, and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.
Sauté sliced beef in a pan until browned.
Add mushrooms and cook until soft.
Stir in sour cream and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve over egg noodles.
Marinate pork in spices and pineapple juice overnight.
Cook marinated pork until tender and slice.
Assemble tacos with pork and toppings.
Serve with salsa and cilantro.
Chop all vegetables (zucchini, eggplant, bell peppers, tomatoes, onion, and garlic) into small, even pieces to ensure even cooking.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they are translucent.
Add the garlic and sauté for another minute until fragrant.
Add the chopped zucchini, eggplant, and bell peppers to the skillet, stirring well to combine.
Sauté the vegetables for about 5-7 minutes until they start to soften.
Add the chopped tomatoes and stir well. Season with salt, pepper, and your choice of herbs (like thyme, basil, or oregano).
Lower the heat and cover the skillet. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until all vegetables are tender and the flavors are combined.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.
Sauté seafood in a large pan until just cooked.
Add bell peppers, green beans, and tomatoes, stirring to combine.
Add rice and stir to coat in the flavors.
Pour in broth, saffron, and spices, and cook until rice is tender.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
Slice the eggplant into rounds, sprinkle with salt, and let sit for 30 minutes to draw out moisture.
Rinse the salted eggplant and pat dry with paper towels.
Peel and slice the potatoes thinly. Layer them in a baking dish.
In a pan, brown the ground beef over medium heat, breaking it up with a spatula until fully cooked.
Add chopped onions and garlic to the ground beef, cooking until onions are translucent.
Layer the browned meat over the potatoes in the baking dish.
In a saucepan, melt butter, whisk in flour to make a roux, then gradually add milk, stirring until thickened.
Pour the béchamel sauce over the meat layer, then layer the eggplant on top.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 45 minutes until golden brown.
Let rest for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.
Brown ground lamb in a skillet over medium heat until fully cooked.
Drain excess fat from the skillet and set aside the browned lamb.
In the same skillet, sauté onions, carrots, and peas until soft.
Add the browned lamb back to the skillet along with seasonings and mix well.
Prepare mashed potatoes with potatoes, butter, and cream until smooth.
Layer ground meat mixture in a baking dish and top with mashed potatoes.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) until the top is golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.
Brown chicken thighs in a pot over medium heat until golden.
Remove chicken from pot and set aside.
Add diced onions, carrots, and mushrooms to the pot and sauté until tender.
Deglaze the pot with red wine, scraping up any brown bits from the bottom.
Return the chicken to the pot and add chicken broth.
Season with thyme, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
Simmer on low heat for about 45 minutes until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Serve hot with crusty bread or over noodles.
Cut the chuck roast into 2-inch cubes and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a pot over medium-high heat and brown the chuck roast on all sides.
Add chopped onions, bell peppers, and carrots, and cook until softened.
Stir in the paprika, black pepper, and salt.
Add tomato paste and stir to combine, then add enough beef broth to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours until meat is tender.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley, with bread or noodles on the side.
Prepare the potatoes: peel, wash, and cut them into thick chips.
Soak the potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes to remove excess starch.
Drain the potatoes and pat them dry with a towel.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 180°C (350°F).
Fry the potato chips in batches until they are soft but not golden, then remove and let cool.
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, salt, pepper, and paprika to create the batter.
Gradually add cold water to the dry ingredients, whisking until the batter is smooth and thick.
Dip each cod fillet into the batter, ensuring an even coat.
Fry the battered fish in hot oil until golden and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the fish and let it drain on paper towels.
Return the pre-fried chips to the hot oil and fry again until crispy and golden.
Serve the fish and chips hot with tartar sauce or lemon wedges.
Soak chickpeas in water overnight to soften.
Drain and grind chickpeas to a coarse paste.
Combine chickpeas with spices, garlic, onion powder, and salt. Mix thoroughly.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a pan to 180°C (350°F) and fry falafel balls until golden brown on all sides.
Serve hot with tahini sauce or pita bread.
Heat oil in a skillet and sauté onions and red bell peppers until soft.
Add tomatoes, paprika, cumin, and chili flakes, then simmer until thickened.
Crack eggs into the sauce, cover, and cook until the eggs reach desired doneness.
Serve hot with bread or pita.
Brown ground beef with onions and bell peppers in a large pot until beef is cooked through.
Add kidney beans, tomato paste, and spices to the pot, stirring to combine.
Simmer the mixture on low heat for 30 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
Serve hot with rice or cornbread.
Cut the chuck roast into large cubes, about 2 inches each, and pat dry with paper towels.
In a large pot over medium heat, add a small amount of oil and brown the meat on all sides. Work in batches if necessary.
Remove the meat from the pot and set aside. In the same pot, add diced onions and sliced mushrooms. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic, thyme, and a bay leaf to the pot, stirring constantly for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Return the beef to the pot and pour in red wine. Bring to a simmer and cook until wine reduces by half.
Add enough beef broth to cover the meat. Cover the pot, reduce heat, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours until the meat is tender.
Serve hot with fresh crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.
